page.title: 14TRANSPORT 1
page.content: Hullavington village is situated in a rural part of Wiltshire, linked to its bigger towns by the A429 road. Chippenham is approximately 15 kilometres south & Malmesbury 10 kilometres north.The M4 Motorway runs about 4 kilometres south of the village & is the link to London or the rest of the country. We were interested in the ways we came to school. Of 94 children questioned,15 came by car,1 by bus,13 on bicycles & 65 children walked.The family ownership of cars was high. Ninety children had one family car & seventeen had two cars.Only four families did not own a car. Three children did not own a bicycle. A railway line from Bristol to London crosses the northern part of the area, but Hullavington Station has been closed for many years.
